string.value: Did you forget? You're not in any games at the moment!
{0} has started a game! Use /join to have so much fun you'll even forget what you are!
A new game has been started by {0}! Use /join to get eaten by amnesiac wolves!
{0} has started a chaos game! Use /join to take part in the confusion!
A new chaos game has been started by {0}! Use /join to get killed by accident!
Sorry, You're going to have to wait in line, and watch patiently until this round is done.
You're already here! You can't be here twice you sill fuzzball
1 minute left to /join, don't forget about it!
{0} seconds left to /join
Everyone forgot about this group... We didn't reach 5 players, cancelling game!

Game is starting, please wait while I assign roles and update the database. Something strange is happening to the village! For some reason, non of the Furries can seem to remember who they are... (roles will not be revealed to their players!)
{0} is banned for attempting an exploit (no names starting with /)
{0}, did you forget to change your name? Please do that, otherwise you can't join!
Sorry, max player limit has been reached! Remember to try again on the /nextgame!
{0} forgot who they are! {1} amnesiac furballs, {2} minimum, {3} max
{0}, you forgot to PM the bot first! Click the button below or this: {1}, then click start. If you don't, the bot will forget you wanted to play...
You can't run away! YOU'RE DEAD! Get back in the ground! Crazy furries...
{0} has fled in terror! How dare they!
{0} had forgotten, but was {1}
{0} amnesiacs remain.
You don't even know what you are but you already want to do something? Take a breath! I didn't ask you anything yet!
Did you forget? You can't do that unless you're playing!
Looks like I've forgotten who you're talking about... I can't find a player by that name!
Did you forget how to play too? This answer is not valid!
{0} has voted to do something to {1}
{0} has voted to lynch {1}
*{0}* has not voted 2 nights in a row. The forces of good have seen this as a terrible crime, and as a result *{0}* gets put to the noose as an example to the rest *{1}*
Your role changed, but from what, and to what?
Choice accepted
\nYou may not remember what you are, but you do remember someone important: {0}
{0} is dead! Your role changed, but from what, and to what?
You start to forget a name... What was it, {1}? Wait... What were you thinking about, again? Amidst the names in your head, a new one appears: {0}!
You may not remember for sure what you are, but at least now you know this: {0} is {1}!
Who do you want to lynch?
You know you should be doing something to someone, but whom should you choose? And why is the number 2 stuck in your head?
You know you should be doing something to someone, but whom should you choose? And why is the number {0} stuck in your head?

That's strange... you can't seem to remember what you are, only that you should do something during the night!
Dusk draws near, and the furballs gathers to decide who should... forget to breathe this time. Everyone now has {0} seconds to vote!
It is now day time. All of you have {0} seconds to try and find out your role... And if you manage to, everyone else's!
Night has fallen. Everyone heads to bed, hoping to wake up with all their memories. Night players: you have {0} seconds to use your actions!
The furries have cast their votes, hoping to have made the best choice even with so little information. {0} is dead. {1}
Unable to come up with a proper decision on who to lynch, the mob returns to their homes for the night, frustrated...
Looks like everyone spent so much time pointing that nobody voted.

The furries gather in the morning, but do not see {0}. They wander over to the house, only to find a disembowelled corpse of the rat. All that remains is an old *badge* along with several other bloodstained notes...
Morning comes, and to everyone's dismay; *{0}* is in the center of town, impaled on top of their own spear. Very, very much dead. You have lost your *tiger*.

As everyone comes out of their houses, they find signs of a struggle, some scales strewn about and markings of fire in the town square, and far off in the distance you hear a familiar roar of *{0}*. You have lost your *dragon*.
The villagers awake in the morning, to find that *{0}* is missing. Their ouija board and tarot cards, both torn by clawmarks and doused in blood. The *Owl* is dead.
Everyone wakes to find *{0}* missing. Checking the pub and find cups strewn about, some broken, some filled with barf, but more of them filled with blood and fur.

As the sun rises above the village, they find *{0}* missing. Their ouija board has been torn by giant claws and covered in blood, but their deck of... bicycle playing cards? happens to be visible, though still essentially useless. WHAT A *FOOL*!

As everyone rises in the morning, they smell a terrible stink. They follow the smell to find *{0}* lying in in the pig pen, torn apart by giant claws. Going through their things, it's clear that: \n*{1}*
A noticeable stench is coming from *{0}'s* house... the village inspects it to find a dark altar, still faintly glowing with dark power... a *snake* has been captured by the mongoose!
The furries gather the next morning in the village center, to sighs of relief - it appears there was no attack the previous night.
Your role changed, but from what, and to what?
You may not remember what you are, but you do remember someone important: {0}
Amidst the names in your head, a new one appears: {0}!
Oh no! The wolves ate you. NOMNOMNOMNOM
Did something happen at {0}'s house last night? You can't seem to remember...
You went to a wolf's house! You got eaten...
Did something happen at {0}'s house last night? You can't seem to remember...
Did something happen at {0}'s house last night? You can't seem to remember...
{0} wasn't home!
Did something happen last night? You can't seem to remember...
The fox decided to take the wrong night for deciding to recover and write some new fanfics. *{0}* has been eaten by the wolves
{0} wasn't home!
You slip into *{0}'s* house for a little fun, but only to be confronted by a wolf and the wolf doesn't seem up for hearing about your ships.

*{0}* slipped into the wrong house last night! All that's found of them is their handcuffs tied to the church doors, bloodstains from over the night, and a notebook torn to pieces on illicit pairings. The fox is dead.

*{0}* slips into *{1}'s* house, ready to have a little fun. However, they instead find a werewolf tearing *{1}* limb from limb! The werewolf quickly and forcibly drags *{0}* in to add them to the bloody mess. *{0}* is dead.
Did something happen at {0}'s house last night? You can't seem to remember...
Did something happen last night? You can't seem to remember...
You may not remember for sure what you are, but at least now you know this: {0} is the Rat 🕵!
You may not remember for sure what you are, but at least now you know this: {0} is {1}!
Looks like {0} came back positive after a night with the Harlot! The gunner got revenge. {1} is dead.
Suddenly, a loud roar sounds in the village. The village turns to see *{0}* spitting fire at *{1}* burning them to ash and cinders. A *{2}*
With that, the wolf leaps onto the remaining villager, delighting in their last meal. The *werewolf* has won!
With that, the wolves grab and leap upon the remaining villagers, enjoying their last, bloody meal... The *werewolves* have won!
With that, you see the last of the wolves killed off, the corpse shifting into a much bigger and bulkier wolf as confirmation. The comparatively peaceful furries have won!
Oh no! You lynched the *Hyena*! Their laugh keeps going on within the town even as they're dead, basically meaning they win the game, silly.
Suddenly, the survivors remembered everything! Their names, roles and teams were:

As everyone rises, they find the body of {0} shoved into a pile of stone, blood splattered everywhere. One of your otters has died!

Everyone wakes up in the morning, and notices that {0} is not around.... The furries look around and find {0}; torn apart, and nothing to identify them by.
As the furries gather as the sun rises, the find that {0} is missing; somehow leaving, or getting dragged away last night...
You start to forget a name... What was it, {0}? Wait... What were you thinking about, again?

The village has chosen to hang you! The fear of death makes you regain some clarity, and you know what to do... This is your last chance, choose to kill someone as you go down!
{0} fumbles to get away as the noose tightens, but cannot do so in time, and falls to their death with a loud snap of their neck...
{0} breaks free before they're finished being hung...but then they can't make a decision on what to do, so they accept their fate...

As the noose starts to tighten around {0} they break free before they're finished being killed and with what strength they can muster go to beat {1} into the ground just before beeing forcibly sent to their coffin! {1}. {2}
You've been deathly wounded! The fear of death makes you regain some clarity, and you know what to do... you have the chance to take someone with you.... make it quick!
{0} starts to stumble out of their house looking around but before they can make a decision they let out a groan and give in to their wounds afflicted on them by their attacker.
{0} starts to stumble out of their house looking around but they can't decide who to go after.... and accept the fate given...
{0} starts to stumble out of their house looking around before turning to {1} and shoving them to the floor making sure to use the last of their rage to pulverize {1}. {2}
{0} went to {1}'s house and is now dead!
The wolves attacked the bear last night, but were met with a fight... The bear may have died, but {0} died too!
The wolf tried to attack the bear last night, but the bear was able to take the wolf {0} down!
The wolves attempted to have a nice late night snack, but were instead greeted by a crazed murderer! {0} was stung to their doom!
It seemed a quiet enough night for {0}, but they were wrong. The furries gather in the morning to find {0} split from head to toe, but oddly the liver was missing... The wasp has struck again! {1}

With {0}'s dying breath, {1} rushes over and falls, crying. They cannot stand the loss of their loved one, and kill themselves with the nearest poison they can find. {2}

True love endures! The lovers have won!
In the middle of the town square, everyone finds the body of {0}, multiple claw marks to the body. Looks like they tried to sneak up on the Bear! {1}
Did something happen last night? You can't seem to remember...
Did you forget? You are already on the wait list for {0}!
You have been added to the wait list for {0}. Don't worry, I won't forget to PM you when the next game is starting!
A new game is starting in {0}! Don't forget to join!
Morning comes, and the remaining two furries walk out to the town square. {0} takes a look at {1}, gets a big grin on their face, and stabs {1} 42 times with their stinger.
Everyone in the village has died... there's nothing but bodies left. No one wins this round, except the vultures... (now where did they come from?)

As the sun rises, {0} and {1} walk out into the village. Notcinting that they're the only two left {0} goes over to sting {1}. They both struggle and fight for control, though both end up getting plenty of wounds before ending up killing each other./n The village is empty , there is no winner!
You forgot to make a choice, so the I've has chosen for you: {0}
Won
Lost
Player {0} forgot to vote and has been killed because of it {1} times in the past 24 hours.

Every player is a furry, able to vote every day to try and lynch the bunies's enemies (or their own...), but some people are nothing other than bunnies! In that case, they won't have any actions for the whole game (other than the lynch vote), and their deaths will only make a difference as another number.
NO ACTIONS, ever! Rolenames: Villager/Bunny

The Owl may choose a player every night, and will find out their role once morning comes. Careful when revealing what you've found out to others, though: lots of people in the villager want an owl dead... Trust no one, not even yourself: you may be the derp! (/aboutfool) When looking at the Mongrel, there's a 50% chance of seeing them as either a villager or a wolf.
NIGHT ACTIONS, every night! Rolenames: Owl/Seer

Every night, all wolves in the pack vote to decide who to attack. Not all players should be attacked, though! The newest wolf in a pack will be killed if the Wasp is attacked, and may be killed if the target is the Bear (30% chance for a sole wolf to die - and not be able to kill the Hunter! - and an additional 20% chance for the newest wolf to die for each additional wolf in the pack!) All wolves will get disabled if they attack the Poison frog, and won't be able to do any actions the next night! The Fox probably won't be home, so the night will be wasted if you try to attack them! Good news, though: if you attack the husky, they will become a wolf along with you! If you kill a Lemur's rolemodel, they will also become a wolf! \nIf you attack the drunk, you yourself will become drunk, and will be unable to do the next attack as you sleep off your hangover! (Usually, this means you can't attack the following night, but if the Wolf Cub was killed and the Drunk was your first choice, you won't be able to kill the second player, and you will still be able to attack the following night.)
NIGHT ACTIONS, every night!

The Harlot will be given the chance to visit another player each night. They will notice something happened, even if they don't remember what. The harlot dies if they visit a wolf or the Serial Killer, so visiting is a good way to find safe players, even if it's as a sacrifice! The harlot will also die if they visit a house attacked by the wolves or if the Serial Killer chooses to kill them! When visiting a cultist, the harlot has a 50% chance of finding out their role!
NIGHT ACTIONS, every night!

The Drunk is just like a villager... Except when they're killed by wolves! Then the wolves will become drunk too, and unable to attack next time!
NO ACTIONS, ever!

The Cursed is just like a villager... Until they're attacked by the wolves! Then they become a wolf as well, and join the pack!
NO ACTIONS, until their role changes!

strings.string:
The Traitor is just like a villager... Until all wolves die! Then they take over the mantle and become a werewolf, ready to attack the furries! When the Seer looks at the Traitor, there's a 50% chance of the traitor appearing as either a villager or a wolf.
NO ACTIONS, until their role changes!

string.value:
The Guardian Angel can choose one player each night to protect from attacks, either from wolves or the Serial Killer. However, if they choose to protect one of those they should protect from, they may be killed!
NIGHT ACTIONS, every night!

Every day, the Detective can choose a player to investigate, and will find out what their role is. There is a 40% chance the werewolves will see the Detective investigating someone, though!
DAY ACTIONS, every day!

strings.string:
During the day, the Gunner will be given the chance to shoot (and kill!) another player. The whole village will know who did it, so they will (probably) not lynch the Gunner, knowing they're on the furries' side! There are only two bullets on their gun, though...
DAY ACTIONS, but it can only be used twice!

string.value:
The Tanner is just like a villager... But if they're lynched, they win the game!
NO ACTIONS, ever!

The Fool has no way of knowing they aren't actually the Seer... When choosing a player to find out their role, they will instead get told a random role out of all roles of alive players.
NIGHT ACTIONS, every night!

Every night, all cultists in the cult vote to decide who to convert. The cult wins when every single alive player is a cultist. It's not that simple to convert players, though!
NIGHT ACTIONS, every night!

The Cultist Hunter has a single job: kill all cultists. Every night, they get to visit a player, who won't feel anything... unless they are a cultist, in which case, the Cultist Hunter will kill them! If the cult chooses to convert the CH, their newest member dies.
NIGHT ACTIONS, every night!

The Wild Child chooses a player as their rolemodel during the first night of the game. Once their role model dies, the Wild Child becomes a werewolf!
FIRST NIGHT ACTION, then none until their role changes!

The Apprentice Seer is just like a villager... Until the Seer dies, in which case, they will become the new Seer!
NO ACTIONS, until their role changes!

The Beholder is just like a villager, but, if there's a Seer in the game, they will be told their name. If the Seer dies and the Apprentice Seer and/or the Doppelgänger become Seer, the Beholder will also be told!
NO ACTIONS, but they do get information!

A mason is just like a villager, except they will always know who the other masons are! If a mason is converted to the cult, all other masons will be told!
NO ACTIONS, but they do get information!

The Doppelgänger chooses a player during the first night of the game. Once they die, the Doppelgänger will become what they were! Unless the player was converted to the cult, the Doppelgänger will become what they were at the time of death! When becoming a Wild Child, the Doppelgänger will inherit their role model. The Doppelgänger cannot be converted to a cultist until they change roles, and will not be able to win (except as a lover) unless they've changed roles!
FIRST NIGHT ACTION, then none until their role changes!

The Cupid will choose two players at the start of the game and make them fall in love with each other. If one of them dies, the other will die of sorrow... If one of them is on the winning team at the end of the game, both will be winners! If the only players left standing are the Lovers, they will be the winners! The Cupid can choose themselves as one of the Lovers.
FIRST NIGHT ACTIONS, then none!

The Hunter is just like a villager... Until someone visits them, or they die! Anyone who visits the Hunter's house will find themselves dead (other than the cult - there's a 50% chance the cult will convert the Hunter, and then a 50% chance a cultist will be killed if the conversion fails), unless they go there to attack the Hunter. The Serial Killer will be able to kill the Hunter, and a pack of wolves will also be able to do that... However, the Hunter won't go down without a fight! When they're killed - be it by lynching or a murder, but not a wolf attack - the Hunter will be given a choice to shoot and kill someone out of the players alive! Wolf attacks work differently, though! If a sole wolf attacks the hunter, there's a 30% chance they'll be able to kill the wolf and survive. Otherwise, the Hunter will be killed by the wolves, but may be able to take one down (instead of choosing a player to kill) as they go! For two wolves, the chance of killing one of them is 50%. For three, it's 70%; for four, 90%, and for packs with five wolves or more, the Hunter will definitely be able to kill one of them as they die!
NO ACTIONS, until they die!

The Serial Killer can choose a player every night to attack and kill. They win if they're the last one alive! There's no one that can't be killed by the Serial Killer, and visiting their house isn't a good idea, since everyone who tries will die... Serial Killers can only be killed by being lynched or shot (by the Gunner or the Hunter).
NIGHT ACTIONS, every night!

Para is a silly developer that likes to bark at people. Maybe he's been messing with werewolves too long....Messing with werewolves is a very bad idea.
ACTIONS AT EVERY TIME OF THE DAY... Para is busy!

As mayor, you are a lowly villager, until you reveal yourself. Then you are given twice the vote count for lynching (meaning that your vote is twice as powerful as everyone else's). Use that power wisely to help the Village Team.
The prince is a key role in the furry Team's strategy. Once it gets lynched, his role as Prince is revealed, and he survives. He then can only be killed at night, or by hunter.
Do you remember the good old seer ? Well now, it has it's Wolf Team counterpart. The sorcerer is the Wuff's Seer. They can only see if someone is Wolf or Seer, and they win with the Wolves.

You are the Clumsy Guy. Maybe you should not have had so much alcohol for breakfeast. You can't see a damn thing. Can you even vote for the person you want to ? (You have 50% chances to vote for someone random)

You are the BlackSmith. Through the years, no blades nor swords gave you as much satisfaction as the Silver Blades the elves ordered.\nYou might have some silverdust left. Who knows ? It might *prevent Wolves from eating tonight* 🤔
You are the Alpha Wolf, the origin of the curse, the bane of banes. Every night, there's 20% chance that you will bite your pack's meal, and they will join your ranks instead of dying!

{0} went to {1}'s house and is now dead!

{0} the fox slips into {1}'s house, ready for a night of passion, only to find a mysterious stranger sticking a needle into {1}'s arm! The stranger decides to pull {0} in so that hey both can get their night of passion..
The furries awake to find {0} hunched over a second-hand scrying board while practising fortune-telling, with head missing. The Owlet is dead.

Seems like {0}, the resident bull, must have been extremely unlucky. Toys and weapons, fresh from {0}'s armory, were found plunged into his hands, feet and head, and pinned to the craftsman's table last night. Maybe the wasp was hoping to expand his weapon collection alongside his organ one...
{{0} was found tied up by their tentacle altar.. The wasp has struck again, regardless of race, language or religion! {0} was a Snake.
The next morning, the furries were heartbroken to find {0} a.k.a. the lovebird dead, ...
The furries had hoped to meet {0} to enjoy a drink or two, or seven, but instead they find {0} skinned clean and drowning in his own poison! What a travesty!
{0} would normally have managed to fight off the wasp, but somebody remembered what happens if you can grab just under the tiger's tail... {0} is down

Looks like {0} was caught napping on his hoard for too long last night! A fireball was heard last night, but all that was there today was some melted gold and a ded dragon. Looks like the wasp was searching for a bad dragon.

Assassination! {0} the mayor was found the deer was found with their antlers bound to the wall of their office while working overnight at the mayor office! Clearly it's the wasp exacting revenge for the asylum robbing him of years of his life!

Bells ring across the village before the sunrise, as armed guards flood the streets investigating the disappearance of Prince {0}. No clues were discovered, but it is suspected that there is a Wasp on the loose...

{0}'s guards were caught napping last night. The royal remains of {0} were found, hung in various parts of the palace, having fallen prey to the wasp poison. No amount of princely blood would deter a wasp's sting.
The furries wake up to a rotting corpse of {0}, split from head to toe, stabs all over. {0} was the Owl; but it looks like those eyes won't be seeing much for a while.
The sound of mournful howls can be heard across the village. A mistake has been made. The wolves have killed one of their own. The Crow {0} is dead.
Cries of "I'm your ally!" were heard last night. All the furries found next morning were an exhumed body and smashed mystical ball, belonging to {0}, the crow. Hunger trumps comradeship...

NOMNOMNOMNOM! The wolves were heard last night, eating up a tender lemur, {0}, leaving behind only a bits and pieces of wolf fur! The village wondered if the wolves felt any guilt climbing up all the way up there just to get at the lemur.

The furries wake up in the morning, only to find the severed body parts of {0} the mongoose, Down in the basement where he'd tie up tentacle cultists, but himself tied up and dead.. long after struggling with his restraints, Lesson learnt: the wasp is not a snake
The body of {0}, the mongoose, was found in the middle of town, albeit stung at a hundred places. Checking if the wasp was a snake does not seem to be a good idea...

While it seemed that the wolves decided to stay good for once, punishing {0}, a snake that decided to court trouble with the wolves, proved too difficult to resist. {0}'s head was converted to a fine supper, home delivered!

The snake ran into unexpected trouble last night. Their newest member had the misfortune of visiting a wolf on the night the wolves decided to stay home, and the wolf found {0} quite delicious. Unfortunately for {0}, wolves have no interest in tentacles.

The snakes thought they would have a new member in their ranks, but they were wrong! {0}, a snake, was minced to pieces and placed at the town square in the morning! Strangely their "holy" tentacle altar was found covered in wasp poispn, as if a statement to show whose religion was triumphant.

Last night, the snake tried to convert the one person in the village crazier than they are. Their newest member tried to convert the wasp, and the wasp made a new piece of tentacle art in the town square of what was remaining of the snake {0}

It was supposed to be a night where {0} would save the village from the killers, but {0}'s pelt as if ready for decoration! left was a note stuck on a needle with wasp poison still present "_I could protect myself better than you can._"
{0} tried to guard a wolf last night. The town woke up to find only the wings of {0} hung on the church cross. Clearly the wolves had an extra meal god-sent, free-of-charge, to their homes.

Knowing only {0} was left, {1} tries to go and fuck {0} up, but {0}'s sleeplessness and paranoia proves too much to handle! All there is left is a knicked out wolf and the last man standing: the victorious bear for the village!

Knowing only {0} was left, {1} chose a time where {0}'s guard was at their lowest. Eliminating the final villager proved to be effortless for {1}, for all there remains is a mutiliated body of {0}, the bear, adorned with parallel slashes to the face.

{1} and {0} walk out in daylight. Seeing weird tentacles trying to sneak out from {0}'s cloak, the righteous mongoose {1} goes in for the final kill, putting an end to the twisted learnings of the snakes that had contaminated the village.
